Class APIClient<T>

java.lang.Object
unipd.edids.logicBusiness.services.APIClient<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigObserver
public class APIClient<T> extends Object implements ConfigObserver
* Represents a client for handling API interactions with flexible request types, maintaining configurations, * and enabling seamless execution. Implements an observer pattern to handle configuration changes.

Class Responsibilities: - Handles communication with an external language-processing API. - Abstracts the logic for service setup, request execution, and managing configurations. - Monitors configuration changes dynamically.

Design Patterns Used: - Singleton: Ensures a single instance of the LanguageServiceClient. - Observer: Implements ConfigObserver to respond to configuration changes.

  • Constructor Details

    • APIClient

      public APIClient()
      Creates a new instance of the APIClient class. Subscribes to configuration changes via the ConfigObserver interface.

  • Method Details

    • closeClient

      public static void closeClient()
      Closes the singleton instance of the `LanguageServiceClient` if it exists.

      If a `LanguageServiceClient` instance is currently active, this method ensures it is properly closed, releasing any resources it holds and setting the instance reference to null. If no instance is present, the method logs that no action was needed.

    • onConfigChange

      public void onConfigChange(String key, String value)
      Handles configuration changes by updating the specified key-value pair and performing related operations if necessary.
      Specified by:
      onConfigChange in interface ConfigObserver
      Parameters:
      key - the configuration key that has changed
      value - the new value assigned to the configuration key

    • setSentenceToAPI

      public APIClient<T> setSentenceToAPI(String sentence)
      Sets the sentence to be sent to the API for further processing.
      Parameters:
      sentence - the text that will be provided to the API as input
      Returns:
      the current instance of APIClient<T> for method chaining

    • setAPIType

      public APIClient<T> setAPIType(APIClient.RequestType requestType)
      Sets the type of API request to be executed.
      Parameters:
      requestType - the type of request to be executed by the API client.
      Returns:
      the current instance of APIClient with the updated request type.

    • execute

      public T execute()
      Executes an API request based on the current requestType and analyzes the given text document. Handles service availability check and delegates the processing logic to the execute method of the respective RequestType.
      Returns:
      The result of the API processing, returned as a generic type T.

    • isServiceAvailable

      public void isServiceAvailable()
      Checks connectivity to the configured service endpoint by performing DNS resolution. Throws an exception if the DNS resolution fails.

    • getRequestType

      public APIClient.RequestType getRequestType()
      Retrieves the current request type set for the API client.
      Returns:
      the APIClient.RequestType currently configured for the API client.
